Posts.Content: A breast cancer diagnosis is shocking, even if it’s hereditary. Whether you are a woman diagnosed with breast cancer, a woman at high risk, or a caregiver of someone affected by breast cancer, Living Beyond Breast Cancer’s (LBBC) FREE national teleconference will help you learn the basics about the role genes can play in breast cancer. Join LBBC in partnership with Facing Our Risk of Cancer Empowered (FORCE) for Breast Cancer Genetics: Understanding Risk Assessment and Testing from 12:00 p.m. to 1:15 p.m. Eastern Daylight Time (EDT) on September 16, 2010. Hosted by Susan M. Domchek, MD and Jill Stopfer, MS, CGC, you will explore genetic testing and possible benefits and limitations, the best decisions to make based on your results, and the most effective way to share the information with your family. For more information or to register, visit www.lbbc.org or call 610 645 4567. Â
Posts.Title: *FREE* Teleconference on Breast Cancer Genetics
